meanings.definition: A mahlstick is a long stick with a padded end used by painters to support the hand that holds the brush.
meanings.sent1: The artist rested his hand on the mahlsticks while painting a detailed portrait.
meanings.sent2: She carefully positioned the mahlsticks to assist her in creating straight lines on the canvas.
meanings.sent3: During the art class, the mahlsticks became the favorite tool for the students to lean on.
meanings.sent4: The mahlsticks acted like a gentle guide, helping the painter navigate the intricate design.
meanings.sent5: The mahlsticks felt like a soft cushion under the artist's hand, providing comfort and stability.

meanings.definition: To mahlstick is to use a mahlstick while painting to steady the hand.
meanings.sent1: He would mahlstick his hand to ensure precision in his brush strokes.
meanings.sent2: They always mahlstick when working on fine details to avoid any accidental smudges.
meanings.sent3: The painter jokingly said he could mahlstick even in his sleep due to his experience.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to mahlstick with ease made her paintings stand out among the rest.
meanings.sent5: Mahlsticking became second nature to him, like an extension of his artistic skill.
